verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the days of Ahaz the son of Jotham, the son of Uzziah, king of Judah, that Rezin the king of Syria, and Pekah the son of Remaliah, king of Israel, went up toward Jerusalem to war against it, but could not prevail against it.
verses.web: In the days of Ahaz the son of Jotham, the son of Uzziah, king of Judah, Rezin the king of Syria, and Pekah the son of Remaliah, king of Israel, went up to Jerusalem to war against it, but could not prevail against it.
verses.ct: During the reign of King Ahaz of Judah — son of Jotham and grandson of Uzziah — King Rezin of Syria and King Pekah son of Remaliah of Israel marched against Jerusalem to attack it, but they couldn't conquer it.

verses.kjv: And it was told the house of David, saying, Syria is confederate with Ephraim. And his heart was moved, and the heart of his people, as the trees of the wood are moved with the wind.
verses.web: David’s house was told, “Syria is allied with Ephraim.” His heart trembled, and the heart of his people, as the trees of the forest tremble with the wind.
verses.ct: When the royal house of David received word that Syria had formed an alliance with Ephraim, Ahaz and all his people shook with fear, trembling like trees in a forest swaying in the wind.

verses.kjv: Then said the LORD unto Isaiah, Go forth now to meet Ahaz, thou, and Shearjashub thy son, at the end of the conduit of the upper pool in the highway of the fuller’s field;
verses.web: Then LORD said to Isaiah, “Go out now to meet Ahaz, you, and Shearjashub your son, at the end of the conduit of the upper pool, on the highway of the fuller’s field.
verses.ct: The LORD told Isaiah, "Go out to meet Ahaz. Take your son Shearjashub with you. You'll find him at the end of the aqueduct that feeds the upper pool, along the road to the launderer's field."

verses.kjv: And say unto him, Take heed, and be quiet; fear not, neither be fainthearted for the two tails of these smoking firebrands, for the fierce anger of Rezin with Syria, and of the son of Remaliah.
verses.web: Tell him, ‘Be careful, and keep calm. Don’t be afraid, neither let your heart be faint because of these two tails of smoking torches, for the fierce anger of Rezin and Syria, and of the son of Remaliah.
verses.ct: "Tell him, 'Stay calm and keep your head. Don't be afraid, and don't lose heart over these two smoldering stubs of firewood — over the burning anger of Rezin and Syria, and of Remaliah's son.

verses.kjv: Because Syria, Ephraim, and the son of Remaliah, have taken evil counsel against thee, saying,
verses.web: Because Syria, Ephraim, and the son of Remaliah, have plotted evil against you, saying,
verses.ct: Syria, Ephraim, and Remaliah's son have hatched an evil plot against you, saying,

verses.kjv: Let us go up against Judah, and vex it, and let us make a breach therein for us, and set a king in the midst of it, even the son of Tabeal:
verses.web: “Let’s go up against Judah, and tear it apart, and let’s divide it among ourselves, and set up a king within it, even the son of Tabeel.”
verses.ct: "Let's invade Judah and terrorize it. We'll break through its defenses, carve it up for ourselves, and install the son of Tabeal as its king."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the Lord GOD, It shall not stand, neither shall it come to pass.
verses.web: This is what the Lord LORD says: “It shall not stand, neither shall it happen.”
verses.ct: But this is what the Lord GOD says: It will not succeed. It will never happen.

verses.kjv: For the head of Syria is Damascus, and the head of Damascus is Rezin; and within threescore and five years shall Ephraim be broken, that it be not a people.
verses.web: For the head of Syria is Damascus, and the head of Damascus is Rezin. Within sixty-five years Ephraim shall be broken in pieces, so that it shall not be a people.
verses.ct: The capital of Syria is Damascus, and the ruler of Damascus is just Rezin. Within 65 years, Ephraim will be shattered so completely that it will no longer exist as a people.

verses.kjv: And the head of Ephraim is Samaria, and the head of Samaria is Remaliah’s son. If ye will not believe, surely ye shall not be established.
verses.web: The head of Ephraim is Samaria, and the head of Samaria is Remaliah’s son. If you will not believe, surely you shall not be established.’ ”
verses.ct: The capital of Ephraim is Samaria, and the ruler of Samaria is just Remaliah's son. If you don't stand firm in your faith, you won't stand at all.'"

verses.kjv: Moreover the LORD spake again unto Ahaz, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke again to Ahaz, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Ahaz again:

verses.kjv: Ask thee a sign of the LORD thy God; ask it either in the depth, or in the height above.
verses.web: “Ask a sign of LORD your God; ask it either in the depth, or in the height above.”
verses.ct: "Ask the LORD your God for a sign — anything at all, whether from the deepest depths or the highest heights."

verses.kjv: But Ahaz said, I will not ask, neither will I tempt the LORD.
verses.web: But Ahaz said, “I won’t ask. I won’t tempt LORD.”
verses.ct: But Ahaz refused. "I won't ask," he said. "I won't put the LORD to the test."

verses.kjv: And he said, Hear ye now, O house of David; Is it a small thing for you to weary men, but will ye weary my God also?
verses.web: He said, “Listen now, house of David. Is it not enough for you to try the patience of men, that you will try the patience of my God also?
verses.ct: Then Isaiah said, "Listen carefully, house of David! Isn't it enough that you exhaust the patience of people? Must you exhaust the patience of my God as well?

verses.kjv: Therefore the Lord himself shall give you a sign; Behold, a virgin shall conceive, and bear a son, and shall call his name Immanuel.
verses.web: Therefore the Lord himself will give you a sign. Behold, the virgin will conceive, and bear a son, and shall call his name Immanuel.
verses.ct: So the Lord himself will give you a sign: Look — a virgin will become pregnant and give birth to a son, and she will name him Immanuel.

verses.kjv: Butter and honey shall he eat, that he may know to refuse the evil, and choose the good.
verses.web: He shall eat butter and honey when he knows to refuse the evil and choose the good.
verses.ct: He will eat curds and honey by the time he's old enough to tell the difference between right and wrong.

verses.kjv: For before the child shall know to refuse the evil, and choose the good, the land that thou abhorrest shall be forsaken of both her kings.
verses.web: For before the child knows to refuse the evil and choose the good, the land whose two kings you abhor shall be forsaken.
verses.ct: But before that child is old enough to know right from wrong, the land ruled by the 2 kings you dread will be abandoned and empty.

verses.kjv: The LORD shall bring upon thee, and upon thy people, and upon thy father’s house, days that have not come, from the day that Ephraim departed from Judah; even the king of Assyria.
verses.web: LORD will bring on you, on your people, and on your father’s house, days that have not come, from the day that Ephraim departed from Judah, even the king of Assyria.
verses.ct: The LORD will bring on you, your people, and your father's house a disaster unlike anything since the day Ephraim split away from Judah — he will bring the king of Assyria."

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the LORD shall hiss for the fly that is in the uttermost part of the rivers of Egypt, and for the bee that is in the land of Assyria.
verses.web: It will happen in that day that LORD will whistle for the fly that is in the uttermost part of the rivers of Egypt, and for the bee that is in the land of Assyria.
verses.ct: When that day comes, the LORD will whistle for the flies from the distant rivers of Egypt and for the bees from the land of Assyria.

verses.kjv: And they shall come, and shall rest all of them in the desolate valleys, and in the holes of the rocks, and upon all thorns, and upon all bushes.
verses.web: They shall come, and shall all rest in the desolate valleys, in the clefts of the rocks, on all thorn hedges, and on all pastures.
verses.ct: They will swarm in and settle everywhere — in the desolate valleys, in the cracks of the rocks, on every thornbush, and on every pasture.

verses.kjv: In the same day shall the Lord shave with a razor that is hired, namely, by them beyond the river, by the king of Assyria, the head, and the hair of the feet: and it shall also consume the beard.
verses.web: In that day the Lord will shave with a razor that is hired in the parts beyond the River, even with the king of Assyria, the head and the hair of the feet; and it shall also consume the beard.
verses.ct: When that day comes, the Lord will use a razor hired from beyond the Euphrates River — the king of Assyria — to shave your head, the hair of your legs, and strip off your beard as well.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in that day, that a man shall nourish a young cow, and two sheep;
verses.web: It shall happen in that day that a man shall keep alive a young cow, and two sheep.
verses.ct: When that day comes, a man will be able to keep alive only a young cow and 2 sheep.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, for the abundance of milk that they shall give he shall eat butter: for butter and honey shall every one eat that is left in the land.
verses.web: It shall happen, that because of the abundance of milk which they shall give he shall eat butter; for everyone will eat butter and honey that is left within the land.
verses.ct: Yet because those few animals will produce so much milk, he'll have curds to eat. In fact, everyone left in the land will survive on curds and honey.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in that day, that every place shall be, where there were a thousand vines at a thousand silverlings, it shall even be for briers and thorns.
verses.web: It will happen in that day that every place where there were a thousand vines at a thousand silver shekels, shall be for briers and thorns.
verses.ct: When that day comes, every place that once had a thousand grapevines worth a thousand silver shekels will be overtaken by briers and thorns.

verses.kjv: With arrows and with bows shall men come thither; because all the land shall become briers and thorns.
verses.web: People will go there with arrows and with bow, because all the land will be briers and thorns.
verses.ct: People will go there only with bows and arrows, because the whole land will be nothing but briers and thorns.

verses.kjv: And on all hills that shall be digged with the mattock, there shall not come thither the fear of briers and thorns: but it shall be for the sending forth of oxen, and for the treading of lesser cattle.
verses.web: All the hills that were cultivated with the hoe, you shall not come there for fear of briers and thorns; but it shall be for the sending out of oxen, and for sheep to tread on.”
verses.ct: As for the hillsides that were once carefully cultivated with hoes — no one will go near them anymore for fear of the briers and thorns. They'll be good for nothing but grazing land where oxen roam and sheep trample the ground.
